title: Smartwater Quality Test Report
description: Breaking down what's inside Smartwater and how it affects your health, with a water quality test report.

body.raw: ## Oaisys score: Owned and produced by the Coca-Cola Company. # Ingredients in Smartwater - Calcium Chloride: - Magnesium Chloride - Potassium Bicarbonate - Electrolytes ## Effects of Calcium Chloride Taking calcium chloride on board through your water supply can be a bit of a double-edged sword. It's widely accepted as a safe additive by the FDA, falling under the GRAS category, but there's a twist—it's all about moderation. Here's the scoop—adding a sprinkle of calcium chloride to your H2O can actually be a boon for your bones and vital bodily functions thanks to its calcium payload. But crank up the dose, and you might be biting off more than you can chew, health-wise. Let's dive into the nitty-gritty: 1. **Stomach Upset**: Chugging too much calcium chloride can ruffle your digestive feathers, causing anything from an upset stomach to more serious issues like ulcers if you really overdo it. 2. **Electrolyte Tango**: Calcium's a bigwig in the electrolyte world, keeping things in check. But an overload from calcium chloride can throw your body's delicate dance of electrolytes out of whack, possibly leading to a surplus of calcium in the bloodstream, known as hypercalcemia. This unwanted guest can bring along fatigue, confusion, and even heart and kidney drama. 3. **Moisture Magnet**: High amounts of calcium chloride can act like a sponge, pulling moisture right out of your cells and potentially leading to dehydration. 4. **Salty Sip**: Too much calcium chloride can give your water a salty edge, which might not sit well with your taste buds, leading you to drink less water overall—not exactly the goal. 5. **Medication Mishaps**: This compound doesn't play nice with certain meds, potentially messing with how your body absorbs them—think antibiotics or bone-strengthening drugs. Now, it's paramount that the calcium chloride levels in your water stay within the safe embrace of health authority guidelines. Got a particular level or scenario on your mind? A chat with a health expert or a peek at the official guidelines will give you the lowdown for your specific situation. ## Effects of Magnesium Chloride In the realm of hydration, a dash of magnesium chloride in your water does more than quench your thirst—it's a wellness powerhouse. This mineral champion plays a pivotal role in keeping your body's symphony in tune, from fortifying your bones to orchestrating the rhythm of your heart and muscles. Let's dive into the transformative impact of magnesium chloride in your daily sips: Daily Dose of Wellness: Sipping water that's kissed with the right amount of magnesium chloride serves up a slice of the essential nutrients your body craves. It's like a silent guardian against the specter of magnesium scarcity, shielding you from the specters of muscle spasms, weariness, and even off-beat heart tempos. Digestive Harmony: Magnesium chloride is the more forgiving cousin of calcium chloride, offering a gentle touch to your gut in modest portions. But don't be fooled—overindulgence can still usher in a bout of digestive rebellion and laxative-like effects. Heartfelt Benefits: Your heart will thank you for a steady supply of magnesium, which plays a key role in keeping your blood pressure in check and your heart beating to the right drumbeat, potentially keeping hypertension and cardiac concerns at bay. A Whisper of Flavor: Unlike its counterpart, magnesium chloride is the understated note in your water's flavor profile, ensuring your taste buds remain blissfully unaware of its presence. A Delicate Dance with Medications: Just as with calcium chloride, magnesium chloride demands a careful two-step when it comes to certain medications and health conditions. It's not the best dance partner for everyone, particularly for those navigating kidney challenges or the high seas of hypermagnesemia. To ensure the harmonious balance of magnesium in your body, sticking to the melody of recommended guidelines is key. Overstepping these bounds can introduce a cacophony of health complications, especially for those whose kidneys don't play the encore efficiently. ## Effects of Potassium Bicarbonate **Benefits:** - Electrolyte Balance: Potassium is a vital electrolyte, helping to maintain the body's acid-base balance. - Blood Pressure Control: Potassium can aid in lowering high blood pressure by counteracting the effects of sodium. - Muscular Function: This mineral is important for normal muscular function, including the heart muscle. **Harms (when consumed in excessive amounts):** - Gastrointestinal Issues: May cause stomach discomfort, nausea, or vomiting. - Electrolyte Imbalance: Too much potassium can lead to hyperkalemia, impacting heart rhythm and muscle function. - Kidney Stress: High potassium intake can strain kidneys, especially in individuals with pre-existing kidney conditions. It's crucial to consume it in moderation, and it's always wise to consult with a healthcare professional before making changes to your diet or water intake. How does this information align with your current needs? Would you like to delve deeper into a specific aspect of this topic? ## Effects of Electrolytes Diving into the world of electrolytes, it's like stepping into the matrix of our body's functionality—each one playing a crucial role in the symphony of our well-being. Let's hit some high notes and low notes on what happens when these charged characters waltz into our system through drinking water: **Positive Vibrations: The Upside of Electrolytes** - Hydration Maestro: Electrolytes are the conductors of the hydration orchestra, ensuring that fluids are harmoniously distributed throughout the body for optimal performance. - Nerve and Muscle Ensemble: They're the unsung heroes in the nerve impulse and muscle contraction band, essential for those epic body movements and groovy dance moves. - pH Balance Jam: The perfect pH is like hitting the right tune, and electrolytes keep the body rocking at the perfect acid-base harmony. - Endurance Tune-up: Sipping on that electrolyte-infused water can be like a turbo boost for endurance levels, keeping you going like the Energizer Bunny. **A Sour Note: The Potential Downsides** - Overhydration Overdrive: Too much of a good thing can lead to a water-electrolyte imbalance, potentially causing a condition known as hyponatremia—think of it as drowning from the inside. - High Voltage Issues: Excessively rocking out on certain electrolytes might lead to hypertension, like a guitar amped up too high, putting a strain on the heart. - Kidney's Cry for Encore: The kidneys are like the roadies of our body, cleaning up after the show, but too many electrolytes can leave them overwhelmed and begging for a break. Remember, moderation is key—like a well-mixed track, the right balance of electrolytes can keep the body's concert going strong. So, keep it groovy, and let your healthcare professional be the VIP backstage pass to your health decisions. How about we dive into another topic that's got you curious? # Test Results A 2018 sample water quality analysis for smartwater is listed below. Please note that in the results column of each table “ND” indicates Non-Detected. ## Residual Disinfectants | Standard of Quality (mg/L) | Results (mg/L) | | -------------------------- | -------------- | | Chloramine (4) | ND | | Chlorine (4) | ND | | Chlorine Dioxide (0.8) | ND | ## Radionuclides | Standard of Quality (pCi/L) | Results (pCi/L) | | ---------------------------------- | --------------- | | Gross Alpha particle activity (15) | ND | | Gross Beta particle (50) | ND | | Radium 226 (3) | ND | | Radium 228 (5) | ND | | Uranium (0.03 mg/L) | ND | ## Microbiological | Standard of Quality | Results | | ------------------------ | ----------------------------------- | | Coliform (< 4 CFU/100mL) | Absent (Membrane Filtration Method) | ## Physical Quality | Standard of Quality | Results | | ------------------- | ------- | | Color (15 Units) | Pass | | Odor (3) | Pass | | Turbidity (5 Units) | Pass | ## Organic Components | Standard of Quality (mg/L) | Results (mg/L) | | ---------------------------- | -------------- | | Aluminum (0.2) | ND | | Antimony (0.006) | ND | | Arsenic (0.01) | ND | | Barium (2) | ND | | Beryllium (0.004) | ND | | Cadmium (0.005) | ND | | Chloride (250) | Pass | | Chromium (0.1) | ND | | Copper (1) | ND | | Cyanide (0.2) | ND | | Fluoride (1.4 – 2.4) | ND | | Iron (0.3) | ND | | Lead (0.005) | ND | | Manganese (0.05) | ND | | Mercury (0.002) | ND | | Nitrate (as N) (10) | Pass | | Nitrite (as N) (1) | ND | | Phenols (0.001) | ND | | Selenium (0.05) | ND | | Silver (0.1) | ND | | Sulfate (250) | ND | | Thallium (0.002) | ND | | Total Dissolved Solids (500) | Pass | ## Sources [Water Report](https://article.images.consumerreports.org/image/upload/prod/pdf/cq_water_reports/SmartWater_2018.pdf)
